content.description:
Center of the overhanging section.  Chossy and hard start to easy vert-chert.   

  Maybe...not even 11D.  Needs a little cleaning down low.  First bolt probably requires a stick clip or to be moved. Equipped by Mike Moore

Start 6' left of the first bolt and traverse in on steep crimps. Climb more chert to the top of this vertical route with ledge rests every 25'.  The opening moves might make it 5.9, while the rest is more sustained 5.7/8.
content.location: Start uphill on the left, next to the runout (but fun) 5.7.

content.description: Third route from the left.  Good route with consistently fun and challenging moves.
content.protection:
Stainless Bolts to Double Mussy Anchor  

This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent. No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents. Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climbers own safety. Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.
Plated bolts to bolt anchor with webbing first bolt is +/-30', bring small cams to protect start

content.description: Second route from the right.  Scramble up to the first bolt and be confronted with a techy crux to get on the face/ramp.  Follow cruiser moves to the anchor (the mussy's on the left, not the chains up and right).
content.protection:
Stainless Bolts to a Double Mussy Anchor

This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent. No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents. Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climbers own safety. Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.

content.description: The best route on the wall.  Starts just right of the slightly overhanging section.  Fun and Cryptic crux between the 2nd and 3rd bolt, followed by really fun and easy chert climbing.

content.description:
4th from the left; starts in the slightly overhanging section to thin chert.

 Open project..unsent...uncleaned...not that hard...just not tried more than once.  Equipped by Mike Moore.
Fun sport climbs on medium quality limestone. Lots of fun "chert" rails.A challenging hike ensures a quiet day of solitude.Thank you to those who contributed to developing this cliff.
